interestingcomments.content:
Trade a Monochrom 1 for an M6? (Film or digital?) /!/ ... but if we’re going to get into it, why do you have your preference between film and digital?

In my case, I’m mostly concerned about image longevity. I recently went through some old family negatives, and was blown away by their quality and how well they’ve lasted. I hear time and time again how hard drives will fail, and I’m worried that my digital archive my not hold up as well.

Am I just being unnecessarily paranoid about digital archiving? The Mono files blow me away, but I’m starting to wonder if I should be putting my money on something that will probably last longer.
